    • getNamespace

      public String getNamespace()
      Description copied from class: Grammar
      What is this grammar's namespace ? This will help separate grammar rules with matching names from different grammars, which is of importance when composing grammars.
      Specified by:

    • canBeSkipped

      public boolean canBeSkipped(Data d, Parse parse)
      Description copied from class: Grammar
      Whether or not a piece of Data can be skipped at a given point in the parse.

      This should only be called on datums which are program text (as decided by Grammar.isProgramText(Data)).

      The default implementation only accepts Tokens which have a SyntacticTag.WHITESPACE tag or a SyntacticTag.END_OF_LINE tag.

      Overrides:
      canBeSkipped in class Grammar

    • word

      private ParserCombinator word()

    • matchesWord

      private boolean matchesWord(Parse parse)
      "A COBOL word is a character-string of not more than 31 characters that forms a compiler-directive word, a context-sensitive word, an intrinsic-function-name, a reserved word, a system-name, or a user-defined word. Each character of a COBOL word that is not a special character word shall be selected from the set of basic letters, basic digits, extended letters, and the basic special characters hyphen and underscore. The hyphen or underscore shall not appear as the first or last character in such words."

      "Except where specific rules apply, the hyphen (-) and the underline (_) are treated as the same character in a user- defined word. The underline (_), however, can begin or end a user-defined word, and the hyphen (-) cannot." Description from: HP COBOL Reference Manual - Character Strings.

      Because anything in a copybook can be replaced via the COPY statement, some COBOL words may contain characters which are not legal otherwise. We allow this behaviour to be configured via CobolWords.useExtendedCharactersInCopybooks() and CobolWords.isExtendedPart(String).

      Note: This will skip all intermediate separators.

    • isCobolWordPart

      private boolean isCobolWordPart(Token token)
